revised_title: Photolysis and Latent Image Formation in Silver Halide Particles
tldr: This study investigates the photolysis of small silver halide particles and their latent image formation. The researchers found that the efficiency of photolysis increases with the size of the crystals, and that larger crystals collect more photons. The results support the Gurney-Mott model and explain differences in photographic behavior between AgCl and AgBr. The effects of surface chemical doping and halide composition were also studied.
